message: I would refer Ms. Pelosi to this quote, """"When the debate is lost slander becomes the tool of the loser."""" ...Socrates

I'm actually an incredibly calm person and I doubt anyone kicked their dog over it. It's frustrating when your area news source throws an opinion out like that rather than just reporting the news. Things like this happen all the time in baseball and they were degrading the team as if it doesn't. That's going to rile some people up. Just because you're passionate about a sports team, doesn't mean that's all you have in life. The person who posted it clearly had limited knowledge of baseball, so they shouldn't have made the comment.

The stories in this series are inspired by true events. How many people of color were ~visible~ in 1969?! If you would watch it, you'd see a young Eleanor Holmes Norton (she's black in case you're to young to know her contributions to women's rights and history) who helps organize a very visible EEOC lawsuit in NYC, one of the first of it's kind, for women working at a newsmagazine who were not allowed to be reporters. There are actually 3 more women of color in the newsroom story, though their lives are not as developed as of yet, in the story line. Yes, it's dramatized; but these kinds of events did take place. Please learn more about history before making uninformed comments.
